hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime BTC Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) with 20-day realized volatility dropping below 40% and Bollinger Band width (20,2) compressing to the 20th percentile of its 90-day range, the subsequent breakout direction (above upper band or below lower band) will continue in that direction for at least 5% over the next 3 trading days with >60% accuracy.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede high-volatility moves. Compression in volatility bands during neutral periods suggests building energy. The breakout from compression in a directionless market often initiates a short-term trend as one side capitulates.
entry_conditions: BTC Bollinger Band width (20,2) < 20th percentile of its 90-day range
BTC price closes > upper Bollinger Band OR < lower Bollinger Band on expanding volume (> 20-day avg)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% move from entry close in breakout direction
exit_conditions.time_exit: 3 trading days if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction reverses within 1 day more than 40% of the time, or volatility remains low (<45%) for 5+ days post-breakout.
